title: Faculty Member (Primary-Secondary-High School) Tuition Fee Support Instruction Letter (IHR-S470-14) | Yönerge
text: Instruction No (IHR-S470-14) Effective Date 18-07-2025 Update Date 18-07-2025 Related Unit / Owner HR / İnsan Kaynakları Direktörlüğü Approved by BT / Board of Trustees Aim This instruction letter aims to provide the support payments to be made to the primary, secondary, and high school education expenses of the children of the Faculty Members who work as permanent academic staff at Sabancı University. Scope This instruction letter covers the Faculty Members working on a permanent basis at Sabancı University. Principle In line with the principles of social responsibility and employee welfare, Sabancı University is committed to contributing to the compulsory education (elementary, secondary, and high school) expenses of its permanent faculty members. This contribution aims to support the continuity of education and encourage stronger employee engagement. Statutory Basis Definitions / Abbreviations Regulations Conditions and Criteria Subject to Support The following conditions will be taken as the basis in the application of tuition fee expense support : It is necessary to be a permanent academic faculty member working at SU. The employee must legally have the custody of the child subject to support. Faculty members who are on sabbatical leave can benefit from tuition fee expense support. Payments are made for faculty members according to the number of children. The support is only valid for children studying in primary, secondary, and high schools (Grades 1-12, including High School Preparatory Class, if any). Foundation schools and private international schools in Turkey are included. Repeating classes, schools abroad, private courses, and private study centers are not included in this scope. 1. Level of Education Support is limited to the child's compulsory education process from 1st to 12th grade (including High School Preparatory Class, if any) 2. Type of School Support is only valid for children studying in primary, secondary, and high schools operating in Turkey. Schools abroad or international private schools abroad are excluded from the scope of support. 3. Payment Amount and Period Education support will be given within the maximum limit to be determined each year in the relevant academic period. Payment is made in 2 equal installments at the beginning of each academic period, in October and February. The request for tuition fee support is made by filling out the Tuition Fee Support Request Form through the system and submitting the necessary documents (payment receipt / invoice, student certificate, and, if requested, custody document) only for the relevant period. If the requested amount exceeds the maximum limit specified in the Tuition Fee Support Request Form , the maximum limit specified in the form will be reflected in the system. After the forms are approved by the Dean and then the HR Director, they are forwarded to the HR team for the necessary checking and payment, and the payment is made at the end of the relevant month. If the limit is not reached in October (if the receipt/invoice amount is below the limit), a payment request can be made in the following months until the maximum limit is reached. 4. Payment Method and Taxation Support payments are added to the faculty member's payroll as a net amount and made in the relevant month together with the net salary . Payments are subject to legal tax legislation. 5. Change of Employment Status In case of a change in the employment contract of the faculty member at Sabancı University (transition to a fixed-term contract, Emeritus, SU retirement) or in case of termination of employment, no payment will be made starting from the next academic term.
